00059 void CovarianceFunction::covariance(double &c, const vec& x) const
00060 {
00061    mat C(1,1);
00062    covariance(C,x.transpose());
00063    c = C(0,0);
00064 }

00072 void CovarianceFunction::covariance(mat& C, const mat& X) const
00073 {
00074         // ensure that data dimensions match supplied covariance matrix
00075         assert(C.rows() == X.rows());
00076         assert(C.cols() == X.rows());
00077 
00078         if (X.rows() == 1)
00079         {
00080             C.set(0, 0, computeDiagonalElement(X.get_row(0)));
00081             return;
00082         }
00083         
00084         // calculate the lower and upper triangles
00085         double d;
00086         
00087         for(int i=0; i<X.rows() ; i++)
00088         {
00089                 for(int j=0; j<i; j++)
00090                 {
00091                     d = computeElement(X.get_row(i), X.get_row(j));
00092                     C.set(i, j, d);
00093                         C.set(j, i, d);
00094                 }
00095         }
00096 
00097         // calculate the diagonal part
00098         for(int i=0; i<X.rows() ; i++)
00099         {
00100                 C.set(i, i, computeDiagonalElement(X.get_row(i)));
00101         }
00102 }

00124 void CovarianceFunction::covariance(vec& c, const mat& X, const vec& x) const
00125 {
00126     mat Xmat(x);
00127     mat C(X.rows(),1);
00128     covariance(C,X,Xmat.transpose());
00129     c = C.get_col(0);
00130 }

00140 void CovarianceFunction::covariance(mat& C, const mat& X1, const mat& X2) const
00141 {
00142         assert(C.rows() == X1.rows());
00143         assert(C.cols() == X2.rows());
00144 
00145         for(int i=0; i<X1.rows() ; i++)
00146         {
00147                 for(int j=0; j<X2.rows(); j++)
00148                 {
00149                         C.set(i, j, computeElement(X1.get_row(i), X2.get_row(j)));
00150                 }
00151         }
00152 }

00162 double CovarianceFunction::computeDiagonalElement(const vec& A) const {
00163     return computeElement(A, A);
00164 }

00172 void CovarianceFunction::computeDiagonal(mat& C, const mat& X) const
00173 {
00174     C = zeros(X.rows(), X.rows());
00175 
00176         // calculate the diagonal part
00177         for(int i=0; i<X.rows() ; i++)
00178         {
00179                 C.set(i, i, computeDiagonalElement(X.get_row(i)));
00180         }
00181 }

00195                 C.set(i, computeDiagonalElement(X.get_row(i)));

00219  void CovarianceFunction::displayCovarianceParameters(int nspaces) const
00220 {
00221         cout.setf(ios::fixed);
00222         cout.precision(4);
00223 
00224         string space = string(nspaces, ' ');
00225         
00226         cout << space << "Covariance function : " << covarianceName << endl;
00227 
00228         for(int i=0; i < numberParameters; i++)
00229         {
00230                 cout << space << getParameterName(i) << " : ";

00278 vec CovarianceFunction::getTransformedParameters()
00279 {
00280     assert(transforms.size() == numberParameters);
00281     vec result;
00282     result.set_size(numberParameters);
00283 
00284     for(int i = 0; i < numberParameters ; i++)
00285     {
00286         result[i] = transforms[i]->forwardTransform(getParameter(i));
00287     }
00288     return result;
00289 }

00300 void CovarianceFunction::setTransformedParameters(const vec p)
00301 {
00302     assert(transforms.size() == p.size());
00303     for(int i = 0; i < getNumberParameters() ; i++)
00304     {
00305         setParameter(i, transforms[i]->backwardTransform(p(i)));
00306     }
00307 }

00358 void CovarianceFunction::applyDefaultTransform()
00359 {
00360     transforms.clear();
00361     for(int i = 0; i < numberParameters; i++)
00362     {
00363         transforms.push_back(defaultTransform);
00364     }
00365     transformsApplied = true;
00366 }
00367 
00374 void CovarianceFunction::setDefaultTransform(Transform* t)
00375 {
00376     defaultTransform = t;
00377 
00378     // Apply the new transform to all parameters
00379     applyDefaultTransform();
00380 }

00390 void CovarianceFunction::setTransform(int parameterNumber, Transform* newTransform)
00391 {
00392         assert(parameterNumber >= 0);
00393         assert(parameterNumber < numberParameters);
00394         assert(parameterNumber < transforms.size());
00395 
00396         transforms[parameterNumber] = newTransform;
